oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Elizabeth Schlappi Roy Acuff collection audio tapes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Radio and television programs recorded off air in 1956 by Roy Acuff biographer Elizabeth Schlappi.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recorded from television Opry TV Film -- Down South In New Orleans (Johnnie and Jack) excerpt -- Making Believe (Kitty Wells) -- Eight More Miles To Louisville (Grandpa Jones) excerpt -- Cotton-Eyed Joe (Cast) -- Grand Ole Opry from unknown date -- On And On (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- Opry TV Film -- How To Catch A Man (Minnie Pearl) -- Knock It Off (Eddie Hill) excerpt -- No Help Wanted (Lonzo and Oscar with Cousin Jody) -- Remember Me (Commercial recording by Lee Moore and Juanita) -- Goodbye Mr. Brown (Commercial recording by Roy Acuff and Kitty Wells) -- Orange Blossom Special (Commercial recording by the Stanley Brothers) -- When They Cut Down The Old Pine Tree (Commercial recording by unidentified vocal group) -- You And Me (Commercial recording by Red Foley and Kitty Wells) -- Put My LIttle Shoes Away (Commercial recording by Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- Folsom Prison Blues (Commercial recording by Johnny Cash) -- I'd Rather Stay Home (Commercial recording by Kitty Wells) -- Rock Island Line (Comercial recording by Lonnnie Donegan) -- I Wish I Had A Nickle (Commercial recording by Hank Williams) excerpted -- Opry TV Film - Close By (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- Moving On #2 (Lonzo and Oscar with Cousin Jody) -- Bald Headed End Of A Broom (Grandpa Jones) -- Crazy 'Bout You Baby (Lonzo and Oscar with Cousin Jody) -- Boil The Cabbage Down (Grandpa Jones and Ramona Jones) low level at beginning -- Bringing In The Sheaves (Credited on tape box as a commercial recording by the Jordanaires) -- Unidentified Television program -- Political Ballads and talk -- OPRY TV Film -- Charming Betsy (Lonzo and Oscar with Cousin Jody) -- The Cat Came Back (Commercial recording by Sonny James) Low level -- Play The Music Louder (Commercial recording by Curtis Gordon) excerpt and Low level -- Wildwood Flower (Commercial recording by unidentified artist)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Acuff, Roy; Johnnie and Jack (Musical group); Wells, Kitty; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jones, Ramona; Minnie Pearl; Hill, Eddie, 1921-1994; Lonzo and Oscar; Monroe, Bill; Moore, Lee; Stanley brothers (Musical group); Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Cash, Johnny; Donegan, Lonnie; Jones, Ramona; Jordanaires (Musical group); James, Sonny; Gordon, Curtis; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953;
